mainBoard.flavorText: Elves of the immaculate class weave flora into living creatures—sometimes to endorse an elite warrior, sometimes to create a breathing work of art.
mainBoard.name: Immaculate Magistrate

rulings.text: The number of counters to put on the target creature is determined only as Immaculate Magistrate's ability resolves. Elves coming and going later won't cause that creature to gain or lose +1/+1 counters.
The target creature doesn't have to be an Elf.

mainBoard.text: {T}: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature for each Elf you control.

mainBoard.flavorText:
"For what are leaves but countless blades
To fight a countless foe on high."
—Elvish hymn
mainBoard.name: Elvish Champion

rulings.text: It affects Elves controlled by all players, not just yours.
This card is now an Elf but has been reworded so that it does not give itself the bonus.

mainBoard.text: Other Elf creatures get +1/+1 and have forestwalk. (They can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)

mainBoard.flavorText: "Gaea sings with the voice of nature rampant: a thousand howls, chitters, and cries, and none of them can be ignored."
mainBoard.name: Gaea's Herald

rulings.text: The ability applies to your opponent’s spells as well as your own.

mainBoard.text: Creature spells can't be countered.

mainBoard.name: Talara's Battalion
mainBoard.text:
Cast this spell only if you've cast another green spell this turn.
Trample

mainBoard.flavorText: "Wirewood cannot hide great size. Only with speed and skill can we survive here."
mainBoard.name: Elven Riders

rulings.text: Creatures with reach (such as Giant Spider) don't actually have flying, so they can't block this.

mainBoard.text: Elven Riders can't be blocked except by Walls and/or creatures with flying.

mainBoard.name: Jagged-Scar Archers
mainBoard.text:
Jagged-Scar Archers's power and toughness are each equal to the number of Elves you control.
{T}: Jagged-Scar Archers deals damage equal to its power to target creature with flying.

mainBoard.flavorText: In a culture of beauty, the most beautiful are worshipped as gods.
mainBoard.name: Imperious Perfect

rulings.text: Because damage remains marked on a creature until the damage is removed as the turn ends, nonlethal damage dealt to Elves you control may become lethal if Imperious Perfect leaves the battlefield during that turn.

mainBoard.text:
Other Elves you control get +1/+1.
{G}, {T}: Create a 1/1 green Elf Warrior creature token.

mainBoard.flavorText: The other tribes call them fanatics, but none deny that the Mul Daya elves have an iron-strong bond to some force greater than themselves.
mainBoard.name: Greenweaver Druid
mainBoard.text: {T}: Add {G}{G}.

mainBoard.flavorText: "The light of beauty protects our journeys through darkness."
mainBoard.name: Drove of Elves
mainBoard.text:
Hexproof
Drove of Elves's power and toughness are each equal to the number of green permanents you control.

mainBoard.flavorText: As graceful as a deer leaping a stream and as deadly as the wolf waiting in ambush on the other side, elvish warriors are the eyes of the forest as well as its unsheathed claws.
mainBoard.name: Elvish Warrior

mainBoard.flavorText: Winnowers live to eliminate eyeblights, creatures the elves deem too ugly to exist.
mainBoard.name: Moonglove Winnower
mainBoard.text: Deathtouch (Any amount of damage this deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)

mainBoard.flavorText: From the highest tiers of Dawn's Light Palace to the deepest shade of Wren's Run, the silver notes of the horn shimmer through the air, and all who hear it feel its pull.
mainBoard.name: Lys Alana Huntmaster

rulings.text: Lys Alana Huntmaster’s ability will resolve before the Elf spell that caused it to trigger.

mainBoard.text: Whenever you cast an Elf spell, you may create a 1/1 green Elf Warrior creature token.

mainBoard.flavorText: "No matter how adept our artistic skill, our effigies can never hope to capture the vibrant beauty of a living elf. Perhaps that is truly why we mourn."
mainBoard.name: Elvish Eulogist

rulings.text: By the time this ability resolves, Elvish Eulogist will most likely be in your graveyard, so it will be counted by its own ability.

mainBoard.text: Sacrifice Elvish Eulogist: You gain 1 life for each Elf card in your graveyard.

mainBoard.flavorText: Before any major undertaking, a Cylian elf seeks the guidance of a visionary to learn the will of the gargantuan ancients.
mainBoard.name: Elvish Visionary
mainBoard.text: When Elvish Visionary enters, draw a card.

mainBoard.flavorText: The faultless and immaculate castes form the lower tiers of elvish society, with the exquisite caste above them. At the pinnacle is the perfect, a consummate blend of aristocrat and predator.
mainBoard.name: Elvish Promenade

rulings.text: Kindred is a card type that allows noncreature cards to have creature types. For example, Echoes of Eternity is an Eldrazi (although not a creature) while on the battlefield and an Eldrazi card (although not a creature card) in zones other than the battlefield.
This cards was originally printed with the "tribal" card type. That card type has been replaced with "kindred". This change does not affect the gameplay function of this card.
While it appears only on cards that already have other card types, kindred is a card type and will be counted by effects that refer to the number of card types among cards in a zone.

mainBoard.text: Create a 1/1 green Elf Warrior creature token for each Elf you control.

mainBoard.flavorText: Like nature, the fern spirals back on itself, eternally seeking its own center.
mainBoard.name: Nature's Spiral
mainBoard.text: Return target permanent card from your graveyard to your hand.

mainBoard.flavorText:
"The elves are right: Death inevitably leads to life. But the truly powerful don't just experience this cycle. They control it."
—Crovax, ascendant evincar
mainBoard.name: Essence Drain

rulings.text: If the target permanent or player is an illegal target when Essence Drain tries to resolve, it won’t resolve and none of its effects will happen. You won’t gain 3 life.

mainBoard.text: Essence Drain deals 3 damage to any target and you gain 3 life.

mainBoard.name: Giant Growth
mainBoard.text: Target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.

mainBoard.flavorText: If you want to destroy something lifeless, make it live.
mainBoard.name: Naturalize
mainBoard.text: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.

mainBoard.flavorText: A banner for bonds of blood or belief.
mainBoard.name: Coat of Arms

rulings.text: If a creature has more than one creature type, and one of those types matches the creature you are calculating for, then count that creature. Only one type needs to match in order to get counted.
If you have a creature with more than one creature type, count all creatures which have either creature type.
Sharing multiple creature types doesn't give an additional bonus. Coat of Arms counts creatures, not creature types.

mainBoard.text: Each creature gets +1/+1 for each other creature on the battlefield that shares at least one creature type with it. (For example, if two Goblin Warriors and a Goblin Shaman are on the battlefield, each gets +2/+2.)

mainBoard.flavorText: A wurm knows nothing of deception. If it opens its mouth, it plans to eat you.
mainBoard.name: Wurm's Tooth

rulings.text: If a player casts a green spell, Wurm’s Tooth’s ability triggers and is put on the stack on top of that spell. Wurm’s Tooth’s ability will resolve (causing you to gain 1 life) before the spell does.
The ability triggers whenever any player, not just you, casts a green spell.

mainBoard.text: Whenever a player casts a green spell, you may gain 1 life.

mainBoard.flavorText:
"Those without beauty are Lorwyn's greatest tumor. The winnowers have an unpleasant duty, but a necessary one."
—Eidren, perfect of Lys Alana
mainBoard.name: Eyeblight's Ending

rulings.text: Kindred is a card type that allows noncreature cards to have creature types. For example, Echoes of Eternity is an Eldrazi (although not a creature) while on the battlefield and an Eldrazi card (although not a creature card) in zones other than the battlefield.
This cards was originally printed with the "tribal" card type. That card type has been replaced with "kindred". This change does not affect the gameplay function of this card.
While it appears only on cards that already have other card types, kindred is a card type and will be counted by effects that refer to the number of card types among cards in a zone.

mainBoard.text: Destroy target non-Elf creature.
